Question: Anyone knows of a way to select all text in a section of a web page (it woud be a DIV in html) without having to select from top to bottom with the mouse? The intent is to click at beginning of the text in the main part of the page (no, adds, no menus, etc) to select and send to TTS app
There are ways to do this editing html code, but I am looking for quick select-to-tts (or could be sent to any other app/extension)
Thanks

Answer:

1: To select all text in a section of a web page (it woud be a DIV in html) without having to select from top to bottom with the mouse. The intent is to click at beginning of the text in the main of the page, no, add, no menus, etc) to select and send to TTS app

Thanks

There are ways to do this editing code, but I am looking for quick select-to-tts (or be sent to any other app/extension).

Thanks.

Answer: To select all text in a section of a web page (it woud a a DIV in html) without having to select from top to bottom with the mouse. The intent is to click at the beginning of the text in the main of the, add, no menus, etc) to select and send to TTS app.
There are ways to do this editing code, but I am looking for quick select-to-tts (or be sent to any other app/extension).

Thanks,

Answer: To select all text in a section of a web page (it woud a a DIV in html) without having to select from top to bottom with the mouse.

Question: How can I use the curl command line program to send an email from a gmail account?

I have tried the following:

```
curl -n --ssl-reqd --mail-from "<sender@gmail.com>" --mail-rcpt "<receiver@server.tld>" --url smtps://smtp.gmail.com:465 -T file.txt

```

With file.txt being the email's contents, however, when I run this command I get the following error:

```
curl: (67) Access denied: 530

```

Is it possible to send an email from an account that is hosted by a personal server, still using curl? Does that make the authentication process easier?

Answer:

655

Using the `curl` command line program to send an email from a server that is hosted by a personal server, still using curl, seems to be easier if we follow these steps:

1. Use the `curl` command to send an email from a server that is hosted by a server, still using curl, which sends an email from a server that is hosted by a server, still using curl, to send an email from a server that is hosted by a server, still using curl, with the email contents.

Here is the email contents.

Question: A friend of mine that teaches math has made many times the following experiment : 

* drawing two circles on the blackboard representing two sets A and B such that A and B are disjoint
* writing on the blackboard $A \cap B$
* writing below : " true, or false?"

I let you guess what is the most frequent answer ( this answer being not worse, in fact, that the other, for they are both inappropriate). 

The interesting thing, according to me, is not which answer is given but the fact that very few students say: " but, thtis is neither true nor false! this denotes a *set* ! " 

I think this experiment is interesting inasmuch as it puts into light the fact that not grasping the ***category a symbol belongs to*** might be one of the major causes of misundertanding in mathematics.Here the confusion is between a symbol denoting an object and a symbol expressing a sentence. I express this as a hypothesis. 

Could you give examples of analogous misunderstandings? 

Could you imagine analogous experiences that would enable a math teacher to clear up students' confusions?

Answer:

1

Certainly. 

In your examples of analogous misunderstandings, here are a few examples:

- The confusion between a set $A$ and its complement $A^c$:

* Drawing two circles on the blackboard representing a set $A$ and its complement $A^c$ 
* Writing $A \cup A^c = \mathbb{R}$ 

- The misunderstanding of a set $A$ and its complement $A^c$:

* Drawing two circles on the blackboard representing a set $A$ and its complement $A^c$ 
* Writing $A \cup A^c = \emptyset$ 

The confusing relationship between a symbol denoting an object and a symbol expressing a sentence can often lead to many misconceptions. 

To clear up students' confusions, a math teacher could:

- Clarify the difference between a set $A$ and its complement $A^c$. Drawing two circles on the blackboard representing a set $A$ and its complement $A^c$ 
- Writing $A \cup A^c = \emptyset$ 
- Emphasizing that $A \cup A^c = \emptyset$ and $\overline{\emptyset}$. This denotes a *set* ! " 

This example shows that the confusion between a symbol denoting an object and a symbol expressing a sentence can often lead to many misconceptions. 

To clear up students' confusions, a math teacher could:

- Clarify the difference between a set $A$

Question: I am trying to create different schemes in Xcode for the Watchkit app - one for Notification and one for Glance.

When I duplicate the Watchkit scheme, and then go to "Edit scheme", to change the Executable in the Run tab, there is only the main executable there, and not the one I just duplicated.

I tryed everything.

Any ideas?

![enter image description here](https://i.stack.imgur.com/rvRIX.png)
![enter image description here](https://i.stack.imgur.com/HrSJp.jpg)

Answer:

1  The main executable is the one that is just compiled. 

In this context, when I duplicate the Watchkit scheme, and go to "Edit scheme", to change the executable in the "tab" to a new one, it still is only the main executable that is compiled. 

I tried everything. 

Any ideas? 

I tried everything. 

Any ideas?

![enter into description here](https://i.stack.imgur.com/rvIX.png)
![enter into description here](https://i.stack.imgur.com/HrSJp.jpg)

Answer: 1 The main executable is the one that is just compiled.

The executable that was duplicated is not recognized by the system when editing the scheme.

Any ideas? 

I tried everything. 

But, the executable that is just compiled is still the one that is recognized by the system. 

Any ideas?

![enter into description here](https://i.stack.imgur.com/rvIX.png)
![enter into description here](https://i.stack.imgur.com/HrSJp.jpg)

Answer: 1  The main executable is the one that is just compiled.

Changing the executable in the "tab" to a new one does not work.

I tried everything and the main executable remains the one that is just compiled. Any ideas on how to make the executable that is just compiled into something else? It sounds like you're working with different versions of the same executable being recognized by your system. 

Here are a few more things you could try:

1. Make sure that the name of the executable that you're trying to recognize as different from the one that is just compiled. Your system might have some naming convention or certain naming conventions that it recognizes. Changing the name of the executable that is just compiled to something else might help. 

2. If the name of the executable that you're trying to recognize as different from the one that is just compiled is already recognized by the system, you might need to make the name of the executable that is just compiled to something else. 

3. If changing the name of the executable that is just compiled to something else does not work, you might need to restart your system. 

I tried everything and the main executable remains the one that is just compiled. 

Any ideas?

Question: I came across a strange issue when testing a site in FF. The situation is this: * `box-sizing: border-box` is applied to everything. * I have a floated wrapper `
`, with a fixed height. * Inside the wrapper is an `` with `height: 100%`. When I add padding to the wrapper, I expect the wrapper to remain the same height, and the image to remain the same aspect ratio, but shrink to fit the height minus the padding. The width of the wrapper should change to match the new width of the image, plus the padding. This behaves as expected in Chrome and IE on both OSX and Win7, but in FF the width of the wrapper seems to remain the same as if no padding was added. Am I missing something, or is this a bug in the implementation of box-sizing in Firefox? This fiddle demonstrates the issue: **Screenshots:** ![enter image description here](https://i.stack.imgur.com/GqlUE.png) ![Result in Chrome](https://i.stack.imgur.com/7KOPg.png) First image is the result in Firefox, the second one is Chrome. Answer:
